rules: Rule1: Provided that a contestant performs a demonstration, they impress the judges.
Rule2: Whenever a contestant impresses the judges, it follows that they receive an award.
Rule3: Provided that a contestant follows a recipe, they are qualified.
Rule4: If a contestant is skilled, then under the condition they have ingredients, they follow a recipe.
Rule5: If a contestant is lucky, then whenever they have ingredients, they follow a recipe.
Rule6: Provided that a contestant is disqualified, they cheat.
Rule7: If a contestant is disqualified, then it is not the case that they violate the rules.
Rule8: If a contestant protests a decision, then they appeal to the committee.
Rule9: Provided that a contestant protests a decision, they do not appeal to the committee.
Rule10: Whenever a contestant uses a knife, they win a prize.
Rule11: If a contestant experiments with a technique, then they innovate a method.
Rule12: Under the condition that a contestant innovates a method, they are not creative.
Rule13: If a contestant is honest, then if they are disqualified, they do not cheat.
Rule14: Either a contestant is honest or a contestant is careful.
Rule15: Provided that a contestant is careful, then if they are disqualified, they do not cheat.
Rule16: Under the condition that a contestant presents a dish, a judge tastes it.
Rule17: If a contestant overcooks meat, then they do not burn sauce.
Rule18: If a contestant competes in a championship, then they perform a demonstration.
Rule19: A contestant competes in a championship or, if they are not qualified, they garnish a plate.
Rule20: If it is not the case that a contestant is skilled or lucky, then they are disqualified.
Rule21: If it is not the case that disqualification implies rule violation, then a contestant protests a decision.
Rule22: Provided that preparing an appetizer does not lead to presenting a dish, a contestant burns sauce.
Rule23: Under the condition that preparing an appetizer does not result in presenting a dish, a contestant overcooks meat.
Rule24: Provided that not being qualified does not imply using a knife, a contestant prepares an appetizer.
Rule25: If it is not the case that not being qualified leads to garnishing a plate, then a contestant is creative.
Rule26: Under the condition that not being qualified does not result in garnishing a plate, a contestant experiments with a technique.
Rule27: Whenever a contestant is not qualified, they do not win a prize.
Rule28: If a contestant is not qualified, then they do not garnish a plate.
facts: Fact2: A contestant does not receive an award.
Fact3: A judge does not taste a dish.
